Kapolri Idham Azis Bungkam Ditanya Kasus Novel Baswedan
01 Nov 2019, 06:03 by Friski Riana, Amirullah
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Kepala Kepolisian RI Jenderal Idham Azis enggan memberikan tanggapan saat ditanya perkembangan penyelidikan kasus Novel Baswedan.
Usai memberikan pernyataan terkait pelantikannya sebagai Kapolri di Istana Negara, Jumat, 1 November 2019, Idham ditanya para awak media mengenai perkembangan kasus penyidik senior Komisi Pemberantasan Korupsi itu. Namun, Idham menunjuk Kepala Divisi Humas Polri Inspektur Jenderal M Iqbal, lalu bergegas pergi.
"Beliau itu ditunggu," kata Iqbal.
Masa kerja tim teknis kasus Novel berakhir pada Kamis, 31 Oktober 2019. Sejumlah pihak mendesak tim teknis yang semula dipimpin Idham Azis ini mengumumkan temuan mereka kepada publik.
Tim teknis kasus Novel dibentuk pada awal Agustus lalu dengan melibatkan 120 personel kepolisian. Tim diberi waktu tiga bulan hingga akhir Oktober untuk mengungkap pelaku penyerangan terhadap Novel.
Iqbal menjelaskan Idham akan memerintahkan Kepala Badan Reserse Kriminal yang baru untuk menyelesaikan kasus Novel. "Kabareskrim yang baru akan diperintahkan untuk segera menuntaskan kasus Novel Baswedan," katanya.

National Police Chief Idham Azis Mutes Questioned by Baswedan Novel Case
01 Nov 2019, 06:03 by Friski Riana, Amirullah
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Indonesian Police Chief General Idham Azis was reluctant to give a response when asked about the progress of the investigation into the Baswedan Novel case.
After delivering a statement regarding his inauguration as National Police Chief at the State Palace, Friday, November 1, 2019, Idham was asked by media crews about the development of the case of the Corruption Eradication Commission's senior investigator. However, Idham appointed the Head of the Police Public Relations Division Inspector General M Iqbal, then hurried away.
"He was awaited," said Iqbal.
The work period of the Novel case technical team ended on Thursday, 31 October 2019. A number of parties urged the technical team that was originally led by Idham Azis to announce their findings to the public.
The Novel case technical team was formed in early August involving 120 police personnel. The team was given three months until the end of October to uncover the perpetrators of the attack on the Novel.
Iqbal explained Idham would order the head of the new Criminal Investigation Agency to resolve the Novel case. "The new Kabareskrim will be ordered to immediately finish the Baswedan Novel case," he said.
